intro: Sida glabra var. setifera, commonly known as silky sida, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves, which are often covered in fine, soft hairs. Its small, pale pink or white flowers are typically arranged in clusters and bloom during the warm seasons. Sida glabra var. setifera is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
